intro: Epidendrum jorge-warneri, commonly known as the Jorge-Warner orchid, is a species native to Mexico. It is an epiphytic orchid, meaning it grows on the surface of trees or other plants without deriving nutrients from them. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale pink flowers that bloom during the summer months. Its leaves are elongated,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. This orchid prefers warm, humid environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
